Bring a touch of historical elegance to your home or office with our Framed Prints from Media Storehouse. This exquisite piece features an engraving of Auguste Casimir Perier (1811-1876), a prominent French politician of the 19th century. The image is taken from "L Histoire de France" by Henri Martin and skillfully reproduced in high-quality detail. The timeless beauty of this Portrait, captured by Stefano Bianchetti, is sure to be a conversation starter and adds a sense of sophistication to any space. Order now and elevate your decor with a piece of history.

10x8 Print in an MDF Wooden Frame with 180 gsm Satin Finish Paper. Glazed using shatter proof thin plexi glass. Frame thickness is 1 inch and depth 0.75 inch. Fluted cardboard backing held with clips. Supplied ready to hang with sawtooth hanger and rubber bumpers. Spot clean with a damp cloth. Packaged foam wrapped in a card.

Ready to Hang Contemporary Framed and Mounted Prints. To ensure the paper is held securely the visible picture may be marginally smaller than quoted.

Estimated Image Size (if not cropped) is 24.4cm x 24.4cm (9.6" x 9.6")

Estimated Product Size is 25.4cm x 30.5cm (10" x 12")

These are individually made so all sizes are approximate

Artwork printed orientated as per the preview above, with landscape (horizontal) or portrait (vertical) orientation to match the source image.

EDITORS COMMENTS

This engraving showcases the esteemed French politician, Auguste Casimir Perier. Created in the 19th century by an unknown artist, this portrait is a part of "L Histoire de France" by Henri Martin. Perier, who lived from 1811 to 1876, was a prominent figure in French politics during his time. The engraving beautifully captures Perier's dignified and commanding presence. His gaze is intense yet thoughtful, reflecting his astute political mind and unwavering determination. The intricate details of his facial features are masterfully rendered, highlighting the artist's skill and attention to detail. Perier made significant contributions to French society as a politician. He served as Prime Minister of France from 1831 to 1832 and again from 1832 until his resignation in May 1834. Known for his conservative views and commitment to maintaining order within the country, he played a crucial role in shaping French politics during a period marked by social unrest. This print offers viewers a glimpse into the life and legacy of Auguste Casimir Perier—a man whose influence extended far beyond his lifetime. It serves as both a historical document and an artistic masterpiece that pays homage to one of France's most influential politicians.
